name: multi-scrobbler
description: Multi-Scrobbler pulls listening data from multiple music services like Spotify and Last.fm and sends scrobbles to multiple platforms. It runs as a self-hosted background service with a minimal web configuration UI.
features: Multi-source listening: Pull playback data from Spotify, Plex, Jellyfin, Subsonic, and other music services simultaneously.
Multi-platform scrobbling: Send listening history to Last.fm, ListenBrainz, Maloja, and multiple tracking platforms at once.
Real-time sync: Scrobble tracks as you listen with minimal delay for accurate listening history across services.
Duplicate detection: Prevent multiple scrobbles of the same track when listening across different sources.
Configuration UI: Set up sources and destinations through a web interface without editing configuration files.
Offline queue: Store scrobbles locally when services are unavailable and sync when connection is restored.
Custom rules: Filter or modify scrobbles based on artist, album, or track criteria before sending to platforms.
Background service: Run continuously as a daemon with automatic restart capabilities and minimal resource usage.
API Integration: Connect with external systems through REST APIs for automated scrobbling and data synchronization.
Advanced Analytics: Track scrobbling statistics, success rates, and service health with detailed monitoring dashboards.
Secure Storage: Encrypt authentication tokens and sensitive data with role-based access controls for multi-user environments.
Bulk Processing: Handle large music libraries with batch scrobbling operations and progress monitoring for historical data.
